results.title: Painter and poet: an experiment in words, music and paintings
results.creator_credit: Michael Warre, Joan Maude, John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: A four part series, containing a total of 8 short films for which contempory British painters were commissioned to script in picture, a poem. Each film is accompanied by music and narrated by English performers. The films were produced by John Halas in association with Joan Maude and Michael Warre who devised the script in co-operation with the painters.

results.title: Painted daughters (1925)
results.brief_description: Painted Daughters is a romantic melodrama about high society and the “flapper” generation. It tells the story of Mary Elliot and Courtland Nixon, dancing partners in the stage show “Floradora”. Mary forsakes Courtland and marries a wealthy admirer, who soon goes bankrupt and suicides, leaving her to raise a little daughter, Maryon. Following in her mother’s footsteps Maryon eventually finds success in a theatrical career. A press agent, Ernest Glenning, decides to gather the original cast of “Floradora” for a charity performance, and Mary again meets Courtland. After the Show they are both injured in an apartment fire and from their hospital beds, by telephone, they arrange their wedding to coincide with that of Maryon and Ernest.
results.description: Painted Daughters is a romantic melodrama about high society and the “flapper” generation. results.title: Paint your wagon
results.creator_credit: Alan Jay Lerner, Paramount Pictures and Joshua Logan
results.brief_description: Lee Marvin and Clint Eastwood star in this famous film version of the the stage musical. Ben Rumson (Lee Marvin) is a hard-fighting, hard-drinking, happy-go-lucky man. His ‘Pardner’ (Clint Eastwood) on the other hand is sober, quiet and gentle. The story follows their adventures in a lawless gold mining town called No Name City (population: drunk). They stick together through thick and thin and share everything including a wife (Jean Seberg). Music and lyrics by Alan J. Lerner and Frederick Loewe

results.title: Pain, passion and profit
results.creator_credit: Gerard Rosenberg, Gurinder Chadha, BBC and International Broadcasting Trust
results.brief_description: Anita Roddick, founder and manager of Body Shop International visits Africa and looks at how women entrepreurs survive and flourish. In Kenya she investigates a successful women’s cooperative producing an efficient earthenware stove and in Ghana she looks at a food preservation business and a clothing industry, both managed by women.

results.title: Pain (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: David A. Tapper and Time-Life Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Coping with Serious Illness”.
Meryl Streep hosts this film discussing with experts in the field of managing pain. Joan Robinson suffers from cancer. She has lived with unremitting chronic pain for months and years along with her husband Eric which clouded their work and personal lives. Joan and her doctors explored many kinds of medication with mixed results - sometimes they would work, others not so.

results.title: Pageant of the high country
results.brief_description: North eastern Victoria, a land of rugged mountains and fertile valleys takes on a variety of aspects with changes in weather. As the winter snows melt, cattle are taken to graze on the lush plains of Mount Dargo and Bogong, under the supervision of the Soil Conservation Authority. The Kiewa hydro-electricity plant harnesses the waters of the mountain rivers. In winter it becomes a popular playground for ski enthusiasts.

results.title: Paganini strikes again
results.creator_credit: Cyril Randell, CFF Productions and Gerry O'Hara
results.brief_description: Based on the book by Benjamin Lee. This story tells of Mike and Bill, who on returning from a violin lesson, get stuck in a lift and by chance see a clue to a criminal’s identity - his feet. Should they tell the police? And why is the strange boy in their form so scared?

results.title: Paderewski playing his Minuet followed by Beethoven's Moonlight Sonata
results.brief_description: The famous pianist, Paderewski, plays Beethoven’s Nocturne in C sharp minor, Opus 27 (better known as the “Moonlight Sonata”), and his own composition, Paderewski’s Minuet in G. Contains interesting footage of the audience and the wonderful “art deco” venue.
